description: Brett Ratner abruptly left following a firestorm over his use of a gay slur and his sex talk on Howard Stern’s radio show.
title: Brett Ratner, Film Director, Resigns as Oscar Co-Producer
title_page: Brett Ratner, Film Director, Resigns as Oscar Co-Producer - The New York Times
maintext:
LOS ANGELES — Brett Ratner on Tuesday abruptly resigned as the co-producer of next year’s Oscar broadcast, after he used an anti-gay slur at a public event and made frank sexual remarks on Howard Stern’s radio show.
In a statement late Tuesday, Mr. Ratner said he had resigned after speaking with Tom Sherak, the president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, which awards the Oscars.
“He did the right thing, and they did the right thing,” Rob Epstein, a member of the academy’s governing board and a director of “The Celluloid Closet,” said of Mr. Ratner and the academy on Tuesday. “I’m proud to be associated with a group that made the right call.”
Whether Mr. Ratner’s resignation would affect Eddie Murphy’s plans to host the Oscar telecast, set for Feb. 26 on ABC, remained unclear. Mr. Murphy’s agents and publicist had no immediate response on Tuesday evening.
